climate.narrative 0.2.3

Function that generates a markdown content of the report

Source: R/functions.R
get_standard_report_contents.Rd

Function that generates a markdown content of the report

get_standard_report_contents(
  tabs,
  scenarios,
  sections,
  exposure_classes,
  inputs,
  report_version,
  report_scenario_selection,
  is_rtf,
  exec_summary_layout = 1,
  include_exposures,
  rep_type = NULL
)

Arguments

tabs

List of tabs (required for the executive summary)

scenarios

List of scenarios

sections

List of non-scenario report sections

exposure_classes

List of exposure classes (sectors)

inputs

data frame of all relevant inputs (the reactive expression all_inputs or its subset obtained with get_inputs)

report_version

enables different versions of the reports within a single code, see global file for possible choices and their meaning

report_scenario_selection

(user-friendly) scenario name (or empty string)

is_rtf

a flag that triggers several format specific settings:

  • TRUE: include non-scenario sections (e.g. intro)

  • FALSE: include the links to page top (note requires proper report_version as well)

exec_summary_layout

determines the structure of the executive summary (see get_executive_summary function)

include_exposures

whether to include tables with contributing exposures

rep_type

additional possibility to filter report sections, by default (NULL) no filtering

Value

vector of string - executive summary text (3 items + 1 per scenario + 1 item at the end)

Contents

Developed by John Adcock, Krzysztof Opalski, Karnan Narendrakumar.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.4.
